result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael P Powell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).
  • Intentionally Subject an Individual at Risk to Abuse - Likely to Cause Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Penalty - Subject Individual at Risk to Abuse - Cause or Likely to Cause Bodily Harm], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.285(2)(a)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Conditions of both counts: No contact with the victim, contact with mother and father as agreed to by them and the agent. Comply with, participate in and successfully complete sex offender treatment as directed by agent. Any and all Internet access as approved/monitored by the agent. Maintain full-time employment, no employment or volunteer work involving vulnerable populations such as disabled persons, children or the elderly. No sexually explicit materials. Pay court cost and supervision fees, submit DNA sample, pay surcharge.

AMENDED 7/7/15: Defendant is not to have any sexually explicit materials except as approved by his agent. (All remaining conditions remain the same.)

timeConds.notes: Commence forth with.  Huber granted for treatment, ADOA, work search, and transfer privileges.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any previously-imposed sentence.

miscConds.notes: Conditions as listed in count four.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to count 4 and any previously-imposed sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with victim B.K. Comply with sex treatment and registration.  Any access to the Internet, cell phones and sexually-explicit materials are at agent's discretion.

Transcript of Sentencing Hearing April 7, 2017 filed by court reporter Kimberly Keel
Filed by Atty Ron Benavides.

Defendant Michael P Powell in court, in custody with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides. Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim notification complied with. Sentencing statements by ADA Burdon and Atty. Benavides. Judge addressed defendant regarding sentencing. Court sentenced defendant on count 4 to 4 years confinement, 5 years Extended Supervision, consecutive to any previously-imposed sentences, on count 5 to 1 years confinement, 2 years Extended Supervision. consecutive  to count 1 and any previously-imposed sentences. Conditions: No contact victim B.K. Comply with sex treatment and registration. Any access to the Internet, cell phones and sexually-explicit materials are up to the agent's discretion.  Not eligible for Substance Abuse, not eligible for Challenge Academy. Court granted 585 days jail credit. 11:05 a.m./11:45 a.m.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 7, 2017 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael P Powell in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attys. are satisfied with information in the PSI. ADA Yaskal made sentencing statement, recommended on counts 4 and 5 - 3 yr. confinement, 3 yr. extended supervision.  Atty. Riek made sentencing statement; argued for 4 yr. probation, read statement written by defendant. Victim's father and mother made statement. Court addressed sentencing. On count 4, Court withheld sentence, placed defendant on 5 years probation, Condition of count 4:  9 months Jail with Huber for treatment, ADOA, work search, and transfer privileges. On count 5, sentence withheld, 3 years probation. Conditions of both counts: No contact with the victim, contact with mother and father as agreed to by them and the agent. Comply with, participate in and successfully complete sex offender treatment as directed by agent. Any and all Internet access as approved/monitored by the agent. Maintain full-time employment, no employment or volunteer work involving vulnerable populations such as disabled persons, children or the elderly. No sexually explicit materials. Pay court cost and supervision fees, submit DNA sample, pay surcharge. $518 costs on ct. 4, $278 costs on ct. 5. Court advised defendant of no firearm possession and voter ineligibility. Court granted 408 days jail credit. Case called 2:16 p.m., adjourned 3:40 p.m.
